com.eatthepath.jeospatial.util
Class SimpleGeospatialPoint

java.lang.Object
  com.eatthepath.jeospatial.util.SimpleGeospatialPoint
All Implemented Interfaces:
GeospatialPoint
public class SimpleGeospatialPoint
extends Object
implements GeospatialPoint

A simple geospatial point implementation. Simple geospatial points calculate distance to other points using the Haversine Formula.

Author:
Jon Chambers

SimpleGeospatialPoint

public SimpleGeospatialPoint(double latitude,
                             double longitude)
Constructs a new geospatial point at the given latitude and longitude coordinates.

Parameters:
latitude - the latitude of this point in degrees
longitude - the longitude of this point in degrees
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the given latitude is outside of the allowable range
See Also:
GeospatialPoint.setLatitude(double)

SimpleGeospatialPoint

public SimpleGeospatialPoint(GeospatialPoint p)
Constructs a new geospatial point at the same coordinates as the given point.

Parameters:
p - the point whose location should be used for this point

equals

public boolean equals(Object obj)
Compares this point to another object. The other object is considered equal if it is not null, is also a SimpleGeospatialPoint (or a subclass thereof), and has the same latitude and longitude as this point.

Overrides:
equals in class Object
Returns:
true if the other object is equal to this point or false otherwise
